qas.question: Which borough of New York City is Carnival celebrated in?
What American holiday is Carnival celebrated on?
What country has one of the largest Caribbean Carnivals?
Over how many people typically attend New York's version of the Carnival?
What neighborhood as the privilege of bearing the brunt of the festivities?

context: Carnival is celebrated in New York City in <a0_0>Brooklyn<a0_0/>. As in the UK, the timing of Carnival split from the Christian calendar and is celebrated on <a1_0>Labor Day<a1_0/> Monday, in September. It is called the Labor Day Carnival, West Indian Day Parade or West Indian Day Carnival, and was founded by immigrants from <a2_0>Trinidad<a2_0/>. That country has one of the largest Caribbean Carnivals. In the mid twentieth century, West Indians moved the event from the beginning of Lent to the Labor Day weekend. Carnival is one of the largest parades and street festivals in New York, with over <a3_0>one million<a3_0/> attending. The parade, which consists of steel bands, floats, elaborate Carnival costumes and sound trucks, proceeds along Brooklyn's Eastern Parkway in the <a4_0>Crown Heights<a4_0/> neighborhood.
